intro: Orthotropis, commonly known as the grasshopper plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Orthotropis species produce small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. The genus is noted for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
